etymologies: Old English bannuc, of Celtic origin; related to Welsh ban, Breton bannac'h, banne, and Cornish banna ‘a drop’

definitions: (originally in indigenous Canadian cooking) a type of bread made with wheat flour, shaped into round, flat cakes and fried or baked

examples.text: students can visit a community elder and grab some bannock

shortDefinitions: bread that is shaped into round, flat cakes

definitions: (in Scottish and northern English cooking) a flat, unsweetened cake made with oatmeal or barley flour and typically unleavened

examples.text: tablecloths are spread across the heather and weighed down with herring, scones, and bannocks
